204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 66%; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Weighted average common shares outstanding &amp;#150;&#13;    basic&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 13%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;47,979,990&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 13%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;47,979,990&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Plus: Potentially dilutive common shares:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Stock-Based&#13;Compensation&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Uncertain Tax Positions&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;In accordance&#13;with ASC 740, &amp;#147;Income Taxes&amp;#148; (&amp;#147;ASC 740&amp;#148;), the Company recognizes the tax benefit from an uncertain tax&#13;position only if it is more likely than not that the tax position will be capable of withstanding examination by the taxing authorities&#13;based on the technical merits of the position. These standards prescribe a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for&#13;the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. These standards&#13;also provide guidance on de-recognition, classification, interest and penalties, accounting in interim periods, disclosure, and&#13;transition.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Various taxing&#13;authorities can periodically audit the Company&amp;#146;s income tax returns. These audits include questions regarding the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;tax filing positions, including the timing and amount of deductions and the allocation of income to various tax jurisdictions.&#13;In evaluating the exposures connected with these various tax filing positions, including state and local taxes, the Company records&#13;allowances for probable exposures. A number of years may elapse before a particular matter, for which an allowance has been established,&#13;is audited and fully resolved. The Company has not yet undergone an examination by any taxing authorities.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Recent Accounting&#13;Pronouncements&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;From&#13;time to time, new accounting pronouncements are issued by the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&amp;#34;FASB&amp;#34;) that are&#13;adopted by the Company as of the specified effective date. If not discussed, management believes that the impact of recently issued&#13;standards, which are not yet effective, will not have a material impact on the Company's financial statements upon adoption.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;In&#13;May 2014, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update (ASU) No. 2014-09, &amp;#34;Revenue from Contracts with Customers.&amp;#34; The&#13;standard requires an entity to recognize revenue in a manner that depicts the transfer of goods or services to customers at an&#13;amount that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or services. ASU&#13;No. 2014-09 will supersede most of the existing revenue recognition requirements in United States GAAP when it becomes effective&#13;and is required to be adopted using one of two retrospective application&amp;#160;methods. In August 2015, the FASB issued ASU No.&#13;2015-14, &amp;#34;Revenue from Contracts with Customers &amp;#150; Deferral of the Effective Date,&amp;#34;&lt;i&gt; &lt;/i&gt;which approved a one&#13;year deferral of ASU 2014-09 for annual reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2017, including interim periods within&#13;that reporting period. Early application is permitted as of the original effective date for annual reporting periods beginning&#13;after December 15, 2016, including interim reporting periods within that reporting period. The Company is currently evaluating&#13;the method of adoption and impact this standard will have on its financial statements and related disclosures.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;In&#13;August 2014, the FASB issued ASU No. 2014-15, &amp;#34;Presentation of Financial Statements - Going Concern (Subtopic 205-40).&amp;#34;&#13;The new guidance addresses management's responsibility to evaluate whether there is substantial doubt about an entity's ability&#13;to continue as a going concern and in certain circumstances to provide related footnote disclosures. The standard is effective&#13;for the annual period beginning after December 15, 2016 and for annual and interim periods thereafter. Early adoption is permitted.&#13;The Company has chosen to adopt this pronouncement beginning with the issuance of this report due to the applicability to our&#13;current condition.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;In&#13;April 2015, the FASB issued ASU No. 2015-03, &amp;#34;Interest &amp;#150; Imputation of Interest (Subtopic 835-30):&amp;#160; Simplifying&#13;the Presentation of Debt Issuance Costs,&amp;#34; that requires that debt issuance costs related to a recognized debt liability be&#13;presented in the balance sheet as a direct deduction from the carrying amount of that debt liability, consistent with debt discounts.&#13;The recognition and measurement guidance for debt issuance costs are not affected by the amendments in this update. An entity&#13;is required to apply ASU 2015-03 for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2015, and interim periods within those fiscal years.&#13;An entity should apply ASU 2015-03 on a retrospective basis, wherein the balance sheet of each individual period presented should&#13;be adjusted to reflect the period-specific effects of applying the new guidance. Upon transition, an entity is required to comply&#13;with the applicable disclosures for a change in an accounting principle. These disclosures include the nature of and reason for&#13;the change in accounting principle, the transition method, a description of the prior-period information that has been retrospectively&#13;adjusted, and the effect of the change on the financial statement line items. The Company is currently evaluating the impact that&#13;this new guidance will have on its financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; background-color: white&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; background-color: white&gt;On&#13;July 20, 2015, the Company signed a definitive agreement with an affiliate of Merced Capital (&amp;#147;Merced&amp;#148;) to form a&#13;joint venture that will acquire and develop Williston Basin non-operated assets. The joint venture will be funded by Merced with&#13;an initial investment target of $50 Million. Investments will be subject to Merced approval, and will be managed by the Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; background-color: white&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; background-color: white&gt;The&#13;joint venture assets will be managed by the Company in exchange for a management fee and reimbursement of third party expenses,&#13;and, after certain investor hurdles are met, the Company will receive a share of profits in the joint venture. The Company will&#13;also have the option to co-invest up to 25% on acquisitions and capital expenditures alongside the venture and any such co-investments&#13;will reside directly with the Company. Upon the sale of joint venture assets, the Company will also have the option to bid and&#13;acquire the assets.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt; background-color: white&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;During the years&#13;ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and&amp;#160;2014, we granted various awards to our Officers and Directors as compensation for their&#13;services. These related party grants are fully disclosed in Note 14 below.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Other Related&#13;Party Transactions&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Property and equipment December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015&#13;and&amp;#160;2014, consisted of the following:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=6 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;December 31,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204

204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Oil and natural gas properties, full cost method:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;  Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The following&#13;tables summarize gross and net productive oil wells by state at December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and&amp;#160;2014. A net well represents&#13;our percentage ownership of a gross well. The following tables do not include wells in which our interest is limited to royalty&#13;and overriding royalty interests. The following tables also do not include wells which were awaiting completion, in the process&#13;of completion or awaiting flow back subsequent to fracture stimulation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;7.88&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s&#13;oil and natural gas properties consist of all acreage acquisition costs (including cash expenditures and the value of stock consideration),&#13;drilling costs and other associated capitalized costs. As of December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and&amp;#160;2014, our principal oil and&#13;gas assets included approximately 8,100 and 10,000&amp;#160;net acres, respectively, located in North Dakota and Montana.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The following&#13;table summarizes our capitalized costs for the purchase and development of our oil and natural gas properties for the years ended&#13;December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and&amp;#160;2014:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;2015 Acquisitions&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;During 2015,&#13;the Company purchased approximately 9&amp;#160;net mineral acres of oil and natural gas properties in North Dakota and Montana. In&#13;consideration for the assignment of these mineral leases, we paid the sellers a total of approximately $102,928.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;2015 Divestitures&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;During 2015,&#13;the Company sold approximately 14&amp;#160;net mineral acres of oil and natural gas properties and rights to individual well bores&#13;in North Dakota for total proceeds of $127,348. No gain or loss was recorded pursuant to the sales.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;During 2014,&#13;the Company purchased approximately 374&amp;#160;net mineral acres of oil and natural gas properties in North Dakota and Montana.&#13;In consideration for the assignment of these mineral leases, we paid the sellers a total of approximately $3,102,568.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;During 2014,&#13;the Company sold approximately 502&amp;#160;net mineral acres of oil and natural gas properties and rights to individual well bores&#13;in North Dakota for total proceeds of $1,441,929. 204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 66%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Purchases of oil and natural gas properties and development&#13;    costs for cash&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 13%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;20,714,004&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; 204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Purchase of oil and natural gas properties accrued at the beginning&#13;    of the year&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;(9,364,796&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;(7,953,801&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Advances to operators applied to development of oil and natural&#13;    gas properties&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#150;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;6,036,748&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0in&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company has&#13;asset retirement obligations associated with the future plugging and abandonment of proved properties and related facilities.&#13;Under the provisions of FASB ASC 410-20-25, the fair value of a liability for an asset retirement obligation is recorded in the&#13;period in which it is incurred and a corresponding increase in the carrying amount of the related long lived asset. The liability&#13;is accreted to its present value each period, and the capitalized cost is depreciated over the useful life of the related asset.&#13;If the liability is settled for an amount other than the recorded amount, a gain or loss is recognized. The Company has no assets&#13;that are legally restricted for purposes of settling asset retirement obligations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The following&#13;table summarizes the Company&amp;#146;s asset retirement obligation transactions recorded in accordance with the provisions of FASB&#13;ASC 410-20-25 during the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and&amp;#160;2014:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-weight: bold&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=6 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Years ended December&#13;    31,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204

 Serif&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-weight: bold&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=6 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Years ended December&#13;    31,&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center; border-bottom: Black 1pt solid&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 66%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Beginning asset retirement obligation&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 13%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;286,804&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 13%; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;160,665&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-left: 10pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Liabilities incurred for new wells placed in&#13;    production&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;48,711&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;103,778&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company is&#13;required to recognize all derivative instruments on the balance sheet as either assets or liabilities measured at fair value.&#13;The Company has not designated its derivative instruments as hedges for accounting purposes and, as such, marks its derivative&#13;instruments to fair value and recognizes the realized and unrealized changes in fair value in its statements of operations under&#13;the captions &amp;#147;Loss on Settled Derivatives&amp;#148; and &amp;#147;Losses on the mark-to-market of derivatives.&amp;#148;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company has&#13;utilized swap and collar derivative contracts to hedge against the variability in cash flows associated with the forecasted sale&#13;of crude oil production. While the use of these derivative instruments limits the downside risk of adverse price movements, their&#13;use also limits the upside revenue potential of upward price movements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;For a fixed price&#13;swap contract, the counterparty is required to make a payment to the Company if the settlement price for any settlement period&#13;is less than the swap price and the Company is required to make a payment to the counterparty if the settlement price for any&#13;period is greater than the swap price. For a collar contract, the counterparty is required to make a payment to the Company if&#13;the settlement price for any settlement period is below the floor price, the Company is required to make a payment to the counterparty&#13;if the settlement price for any settlement period is above the ceiling price and no payment is required by either party if the&#13;settlement price for any settlement period is between the floor price and the ceiling price.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company&amp;#146;s&#13;derivative contracts are settled based on reported settlement prices on commodity exchanges, with crude oil derivative settlements&#13;based on NYMEX West Texas Intermediate (&amp;#147;WTI&amp;#148;) pricing.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;As of December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015,&#13;the Company had total volume on open commodity swaps of 29,000 barrels at a weighted average price of approximately $75.84.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Derivative&#13;Liquidations&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;On September&#13;24, 2015, the Company settled all its 2017 and 2018 derivative contracts and the majority of its 2016 derivative contracts prior&#13;to the expiration of their contractual maturities, resulting in the receipt of cash proceeds totaling $6,255,000. The resulting&#13;gain is included in realized gain on derivatives for the year ended December 31, 2015.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; text-indent: 4.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Crude oil fixed price swaps&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;(755,667&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; 204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-indent: 9pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Gain (loss) on the mark-to-market&#13;    of derivatives, net&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;(6,425,345&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;7,793,421&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Balance Sheet&#13;Offsetting of Derivative Assets and Liabilities&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;ASU No 2011-11,&#13;&lt;i&gt;Balance Sheet (Topic 210)-Disclosures about Offsetting Assets and Liabilities&lt;/i&gt;, requires an entity to disclose information&#13;about offsetting arrangements to enable financial statement users to understand the effects of netting arrangements on an entity&amp;#146;s&#13;financial position. The Company adopted the provision of the standard upon entering into our first derivative contract and has&#13;provided the applicable disclosures below with respect to its derivative instruments.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;All of the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;derivative contracts are carried at their fair value in the condensed balance sheets under the captions &amp;#147;Current portion&#13;of derivative instruments&amp;#148; and &amp;#147;Derivative instruments&amp;#148;. Derivative instruments from the same counterparty that&#13;are subject to contractual terms which provide for net settlement are reported on a net basis in the condensed balance sheets.&#13;The following tables present the gross amounts of recognized derivative assets and liabilities, the amounts offset under the netting&#13;arrangements with counterparties, and the resulting net amounts presented in the condensed balance sheets for the periods presented,&#13;all at fair value.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellpadding=0 cellspacing=0 style=border-collapse: collapse; width: 100%; font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

   &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;on balance&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;on balance&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;recognized&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;on balance&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13; 204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt; width: 28%&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Commodity derivative liabilities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%; border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 9%; border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#160;&amp;#150;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=width: 1%;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#150;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt; text-indent: 13.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Net amount of assets on&#13;    the balance sheet&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;1,154,400&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;7,579,745&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Derivative liabilities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#150;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#150;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Noncurrent derivative liabilities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#150;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#150;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Under FASB ASC&#13;820-10-5, fair value is defined as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly&#13;transaction between market participants at the measurement date (an exit price). The standard outlines a valuation framework and&#13;creates a fair value hierarchy in order to increase the consistency and comparability of fair value measurements and the related&#13;disclosures. Under GAAP, certain assets and liabilities must be measured at fair value, and FASB ASC 820-10-50 details the disclosures&#13;that are required for items measured at fair value.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company has&#13;cash and cash equivalents and a revolving credit facility that must be measured under the fair value standard. The Company&amp;#146;s&#13;financial assets and liabilities are measured using inputs from the three levels of the fair value hierarchy. The three levels&#13;are as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 30.6pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Level&#13;1 - Inputs are unadjusted quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities that the Company has the ability&#13;to access at the measurement date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 30.6pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 30.6pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Level&#13;2 - Inputs include quoted prices for similar assets and liabilities in active markets, quoted prices for identical or similar&#13;assets or liabilities in markets that are not active, inputs other than quoted prices that are observable for the asset or liability&#13;(e.g., interest rates, yield curves, etc.), and inputs that are derived principally from or corroborated by observable market&#13;data by correlation or other means (market corroborated inputs).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 30.6pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 30.6pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Level&#13;3 - Unobservable inputs that reflect our assumptions about the assumptions that market participants would use in pricing the asset&#13;or liability.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0 0 0 30.6pt; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The following&#13;schedule summarizes the valuation of financial instruments at fair value on a recurring basis in the balances sheet as of December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015&#13;and&amp;#160;2014:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=font-weight: bold; text-indent: 32.75pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Liabilities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Revolving credit facilities and long term debt,&#13;    net of discounts&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#150;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;51,834,603&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#150;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: rgb(204
255
204)&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 1pt; text-indent: 10.25pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Total Liabilities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#150;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;51,834,603&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 1pt solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#150;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 1pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: White&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: left; padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;94,682&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;(44,254,858&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=border-bottom: Black 2.5pt double; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#150;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;td style=padding-bottom: 2.5pt; text-align: left&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Senior Credit&#13;Facility&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company,&#13;as borrower, entered into a Credit Agreement dated August&amp;#160;8,&amp;#160;2013 and amendments thereto dated December&amp;#160;13,&amp;#160;2013,&#13;March&amp;#160;24,&amp;#160;2014, April&amp;#160;21,&amp;#160;2014, September&amp;#160;11,&amp;#160;2014, March&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2015 and August 10, 2015&#13;(as amended, the &amp;#147;Senior Credit Agreement&lt;i&gt;&amp;#148;&lt;/i&gt;) with Cadence Bank, N.A. (&amp;#147;Cadence&amp;#148;), as lender (the&#13;&amp;#147;Senior Credit Facility&amp;#148;). Under the terms of the Senior Credit Agreement, a senior secured revolving line of credit&#13;in the maximum aggregate principal amount of $50&amp;#160;million is available from time to time (i) for direct investment in oil&#13;and gas properties, (ii) for general working capital purposes, including the issuance of letters of credit, and (iii) to refinance&#13;the then existing debt under the Company&amp;#146;s former credit facility.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Availability&#13;under the Senior Credit Facility is at all times subject to the then-applicable borrowing base, determined by Cadence in a manner&#13;consistent with the normal and customary oil and gas lending practices of Cadence. Availability was initially set at $7&amp;#160;million&#13;and is subject to periodic redeterminations. The availability was $32&amp;#160;million as of December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015, of which&#13;$27.75 million was borrowed and outstanding as of December, 2015. Subject to availability under the borrowing base, the Company&#13;may borrow, repay and re-borrow funds in amounts of $250,000 or more. At the Company&amp;#146;s election, the unpaid principal balance&#13;of any borrowings under the Senior Credit Facility may bear interest at either (i) the Base Rate, as defined in the Senior Credit&#13;Facility, plus the applicable margin, which varies from 1.00% to 1.50% or (ii) the LIBOR rate, as defined in the Senior Credit&#13;Facility, plus the applicable margin, which varies from 3.00% to 3.50%. Interest is payable for Base Rate loans on the last business&#13;day of the month and for LIBOR loans on the last LIBOR business day of each LIBOR interest period. The Company is also required&#13;to pay a quarterly fee of 0.50% on any unused portion of the borrowing base, as well as a facility fee of 0.90% of the initial&#13;and any subsequent additions to the borrowing base.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Senior Credit&#13;Facility&amp;#146;s maturity date of August&amp;#160;8,&amp;#160;2016, was subsequently amended to January&amp;#160;15,&amp;#160;2017 pursuant to&#13;the amendment on March&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2015. The Company may prepay the entire amount of Base Rate loans at any time, and may prepay&#13;the entire amount of LIBOR loans upon at least three business days&amp;#146; notice to Cadence. The Senior Credit Facility is secured&#13;by first priority interests in mortgages on substantially all of the Company&amp;#146;s assets, including but not limited to the&#13;Company&amp;#146;s mineral interests in North Dakota and Montana.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company had&#13;borrowings of $27.75&amp;#160;million and $22.6&amp;#160;million outstanding under the Senior Credit Agreement as of December 31, 2015&#13;and&amp;#160;2014, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Subordinated&#13;Credit Facility&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company,&#13;as borrower, entered into a Second Lien Credit Agreement dated August&amp;#160;8,&amp;#160;2013 and amendments thereto dated December&amp;#160;13,&amp;#160;2013,&#13;March&amp;#160;24,&amp;#160;2014, April&amp;#160;21,&amp;#160;2014, September&amp;#160;11,&amp;#160;2014, March&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2015, and August 10, 2015&#13;(as amended, the &amp;#147;Subordinated Credit Agreement&amp;#148;) by and among the Company, as borrower, Chambers Energy Management,&#13;LP, as administrative agent (&amp;#147;Chambers&amp;#148;), and the several other lenders named therein (the &amp;#147;Subordinated Credit&#13;Facility&amp;#148;). Under the Subordinated Credit Facility, term loans in the aggregate principal amount of up to $75&amp;#160;million&#13;are available from time to time (i) to repay the Previous Credit Facility, (ii) for fees and closing costs in connection with&#13;both the Senior Credit Facility and the Subordinated Credit Facility (together, the &amp;#147;Credit Facilities&amp;#148;), and (iii)&#13;general corporate purposes.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Subordinated&#13;Credit Agreement provided initial commitment availability of $25&amp;#160;million, which was subsequently amended to the current availability&#13;of $30&amp;#160;million, with the remaining commitments subject to the approval of Chambers and other customary conditions. The Company&#13;may borrow the available commitments in amounts of $5&amp;#160;million or more and shall not request borrowings of such loans more&#13;than once a month, provided that the initial draw was at least $15&amp;#160;million. Loans under the Subordinated Credit Facility&#13;shall be funded net of a 2%&amp;#160;OID. The unpaid principal balance of borrowings under the Subordinated Credit Facility bears&#13;interest at the Cash Interest Rate plus the PIK Interest Rate. The Cash Interest Rate is 9.00% per annum plus a rate per annum&#13;equal to the greater of (i) 1.00% and (ii) the offered rate for three-month deposits in U.S. dollars that appears on Reuters Screen&#13;LIBOR 01 as of 11:00 a.m. (London time) on the second full LIBOR business day preceding the first day of each calendar quarter.&#13;The PIK Interest Rate is equal to 4.00% per annum. Interest is payable on the last day of each month. The Company is also required&#13;to pay an annual nonrefundable administration fee of $50,000 and a monthly availability fee computed at a rate of 0.50% per annum&#13;on the average daily amount of any unused portion of the available amount under the commitment.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Subordinated&#13;Credit Facility matures on June&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2017. Upon at least three business days&amp;#146; written notice, the Company may prepay&#13;the entire amount under the loans, together with accrued interest. Each prepayment made prior to the second anniversary of the&#13;funding date, as defined in the Subordinated Credit Facility, shall be accompanied by a make-whole amount, as defined in the Subordinated&#13;Credit Agreement. Prepayments made on or after the second anniversary of the funding date shall be accompanied by an applicable&#13;premium, as set forth in the Subordinated Credit Agreement. The Subordinated Credit Facility is secured by second priority interests&#13;on substantially all of the Company&amp;#146;s assets, including but not limited to second priority mortgages on the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;mineral interests in North Dakota and Montana.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The first funding&#13;from the Subordinated Credit Facility occurred on September&amp;#160;9,&amp;#160;2013 at which time we drew $14.7&amp;#160;million, net of&#13;a $300,000 original issue discount, from the Subordinated Credit Agreement and used $10,226,057 of those proceeds to repay and&#13;terminate a previously outstanding revolving credit facility. We have drawn an additional $14.7&amp;#160;million, net of $300,000&#13;original issue discounts, through December 31, 2015. The Company had borrowings of $30&amp;#160;million and $30&amp;#160;million outstanding&#13;under the Subordinated Credit Facility as of December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and&amp;#160;2014, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Intercreditor&#13;Agreements and Covenants&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Cadence and Chambers&#13;have entered into an Intercreditor Agreement dated August&amp;#160;8,&amp;#160;2013 (the &amp;#147;Intercreditor Agreement&amp;#148;). The Intercreditor&#13;Agreement provides that any liens on the assets of the Company securing indebtedness under the Subordinated Credit Facility are&#13;subordinate to liens on the assets securing indebtedness under the Senior Credit Facility and sets forth the respective rights,&#13;obligations and remedies of the lenders under the Senior Credit Facility with respect to their first priority liens and the lenders&#13;under the Subordinated Credit Facility with respect to their second priority liens.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Credit Facilities,&#13;as amended, require customary affirmative and negative covenants for credit facilities of the respective types and sizes for companies&#13;operating in the oil and gas industry, as well as customary events of default. Furthermore, the Credit Facilities contain financial&#13;covenants that require the Company to satisfy certain specified financial ratios. The Senior Credit Agreement requires the Company&#13;to maintain, as of the last day of each fiscal quarter of the Company, (i) a collateral coverage ratio (reserve value plus consolidated&#13;working capital to adjusted indebtedness) of at least 0.65 to 1.00 through the quarter ending June&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2014, 0.70 to&#13;1.00 for the quarters ending September&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2014 and December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2014, was waived for the quarters ending&#13;March&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and June&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2015, and 0.70 to 1.00 for the quarter ending September&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2015, and&#13;0.80 to 1.00 for the quarter ending December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and thereafter, (ii) a ratio of current assets, including debt&#13;facility available to be drawn, to current liabilities of a minimum of 1.0 to 1.0, except for the quarter ending June&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2014,&#13;which was waived, (iii) a net debt to EBITDAX, as defined in the Senior Credit Agreement, ratio of 3.75 to 1.00 for the quarter&#13;ended March&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2014, 4.25 to 1.00 for the quarters ended June&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2014 and September&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2014,&#13;4.00 to 1.00 for the quarter ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2014, was waived for the quarters ended March&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and&#13;June 30, 2015, and 3.50 to 1.00 for the quarter ending September&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2015, and 3.65 to 1.00 for the quarter ending December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015,&#13;and 3.50 to 1.00 for the quarter ending March&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2016 and thereafter, in each case calculated on a modified trailing&#13;four quarter basis, (iv) a maximum senior leverage ratio of not more than 2.5 to 1.0 calculated on a modified trailing four quarter&#13;basis, and (v) a minimum interest coverage ratio of not less than 3.0 to 1.0. The Subordinated Credit Agreement requires the Company&#13;to maintain, as of the last day of each fiscal quarter of the Company, (i) a collateral coverage ratio (reserve value plus consolidated&#13;working capital to adjusted indebtedness) of at least 0.65 to 1.00 through the quarter ending June&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2014, 0.70 to&#13;1.00 for the quarters ending September&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2014 and December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2014, was waived for the quarters ending&#13;March&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and June 30, 2015, and 0.70 to 1.00 for the quarter ending September&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2015, and 0.80 to&#13;1.00 for the quarter ending December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and thereafter, (ii) a consolidated net leverage ratio (adjusted total&#13;indebtedness less the amount of unrestricted cash equivalents to consolidated EBITDA) of no more than 3.75 to 1.00 for the quarter&#13;ending March&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2014, 4.25 to 1.00 for the quarters ending June&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2014 and September&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2014,&#13;4.00 to 1.00 for the quarter ending December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2014, was waived for the quarters ending March&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and&#13;June 30, 2015, and 3.50 to 1.00 for the quarter ending September&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2015, and 3.65 to 1.00 for the quarter ending December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015,&#13;and 3.50 to 1.00 for the quarter ending March&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2016 and thereafter, calculated on a modified trailing four quarter&#13;basis, (iii) a consolidated cash interest coverage ratio (consolidated EBITDA to consolidated cash interest expense) of no less&#13;than 2.5 to 1.0, calculated on a modified trailing four quarter basis and (iv) a ratio of consolidated current assets to consolidated&#13;current liabilities of at least 1.0 to 1.0, except for the quarter ending June 30, 2015 when the covenant was waived. In addition,&#13;each of the Credit Facilities requires that the Company enter into hedging agreements based on anticipated oil production from&#13;currently producing wells as agreed to by the lenders. The Company is in compliance with all covenants, as amended, for the period&#13;ending December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015, except as noted below under &amp;#147;Covenant Violations&amp;#148;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Covenant Violations&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;The Company was&#13;out of compliance with the collateral coverage ratio as of December 31, 2015. Additionally, the audit report the Company received&#13;with respect to its financial statements contains an explanatory paragraph expressing uncertainty as to the Company&amp;#146;s ability&#13;to continue as a going concern, the delivery of which constitutes a default under both its Senior Credit Facility and Subordinated&#13;Credit Facility. See Note 3, &amp;#147;Going Concern&amp;#148;, for additional information. As such, both the Senior Credit Facility&#13;and the Subordinated Credit Facility are in default and are classified on the balance sheet as current liabilities.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&lt;u&gt;Debt Discount,&#13;Detachable Warrants&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;In connection&#13;with the Subordinated Credit Facility, the Company agreed to issue to the lenders detachable warrants to purchase up to 5,000,000&#13;shares of the Company&amp;#146;s common stock at an exercise price of $0.65 per share. The warrants expire on August&amp;#160;8,&amp;#160;2018.&#13;Proceeds from the loan were allocated between the debt and equity based on the relative fair values at the time of issuance, resulting&#13;in a debt discount of $2,473,576 at issuance that is presented as a debt discount on the balance sheet and is being amortized&#13;using the effective interest method over the life of the credit facility, which matures on June&amp;#160;30,&amp;#160;2017. A total of&#13;$1,645,749 and $628,195 was amortized during the years ended December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and&amp;#160;2014. The remaining unamortized&#13;balance of the debt discount attributable to the warrants is $-0- as of December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015. The amortization of the debt&#13;discount attributable to the warrants was accelerated in 2015 to fully amortize the discount as of December 31, 2015 when the&#13;related debt became payable on demand due to a default on the related debt.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif; margin: 0; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font-size: 8pt&gt;Amounts outstanding&#13;under revolving credit facilities and long term debts consisted of the following as of December&amp;#160;31,&amp;#160;2015 and&amp;#160;2014,&#13;respectively:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
